bug.author: kolbma
bug.summary: Build problem $ENV{DESTDIR} got expanded on cmake call
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Issue description</denchmark-h>
I think you have a mistake in your cmake scripts. You use $ENV{DESTDIR}. This gets expanded during cmake generating the files for Unix make. So it gets set to the value the env-var has when calling cmake. But this should be set to the DESTDIR variable when calling DESTDIR=... make install! I need this escaped in the form \$ENV{DESTDIR}.

comments.comment: I would like to work on this issue. Where did you find that $ENV{DESTDIR} in the source code.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/files/3046943/01-fix-lib-path.patch.txt>01-fix-lib-path.patch.txt</denchmark-link>

Although up-to-now the python bindings doesn't work on import. But there is another issue for this at <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/1760#issuecomment-479570820>#1760 (comment)</denchmark-link>
The $ENV{DESTDIR} is in src/mlpack/bindings/python/CMakeLists.txt. You can find in patch-file. br
